name: chromosomal inheritance
definition: An inheritance pattern wherein the trait is determined by inheritance of extra, missing, or re-arranged chromosomes possibly together with environmental factors.

name: chromosomal rearrangement inheritance
definition: An inheritance pattern wherein the trait is determined by inheritance of translocation or inversion of sections of one or more chromosomes, possibly together with environmental factors.

name: chromosomal duplication inheritance
definition: An inheritance pattern wherein the trait is determined by inheritance of duplicated sections of one or more chromosomes, encompassing either 0 or multiple genes, possibly together with environmental factors.

name: chromosomal deletion inheritance
definition: An inheritance pattern wherein the trait is determined by inheritance of missing sections of one or more chromosomes, encompassing either 0 or multiple genes, possibly together with environmental factors.

name: mitochondrial inheritance
definition: An inheritance pattern observed for traits related to a gene encoded on the mitochondrial genome.; Because the mitochondrial genome is essentially always maternally inherited, a mitochondrial condition can only be transmitted by females, although the condition can affect both sexes. The proportion of mutant mitochondria can vary (heteroplasmy).

name: homoplasmic mitochondrial inheritance
definition: A mitochondrial inheritance pattern whereby manifestation of a trait occurs when only mitochondria containing the causative allele are inherited.

name: heteroplasmic mitochondrial inheritance
definition: A mitochondrial inheritance pattern whereby manifestation of a trait is observed when some inherited mitochondria contian the causative allele and some do not.

name: monogenic inheritance
definition: An inheritance pattern wherein the trait is determined by alleles of a single causal gene, possibly together with environmental factors.

name: allosomal inheritance
definition: An inheritance pattern wherein the trait is determined by alleles of a single causal gene on a sex chromosome.

name: W-linked inheritance
definition: An inheritance pattern wherein the trait is determined by alleles of a single causal gene on a W-chromosome.

name: Z-linked inheritance
definition: An inheritance pattern wherein the trait is determined by alleles of a single causal gene on a Z-chromosome.

name: Z-linked reccessive inheritance
definition: A Z-linked inheritance pattern wherein a trait caused by alleles of a gene on the Z-chromosome manifests in homozygous but not heterozygote individuals.

name: Z-linked dominant inheritance
definition: A Z-linked inheritance pattern wherein the trait manifests in heterozygotes.

name: co-dominant Z-linked inheritance
definition: An Z-linked dominant inheritance pattern wherein a heterozygous individual simultaneously expresses the distinct traits associated with each allele in the heterozygous locus.

name: incomplete Z-linked dominant inheritance
definition: A Z-linked dominant inheritance pattern wherein the trait expressed in a heterozygous individual is intermediate between the trait expressed in individuals homozygous for either allele in the heterozygous locus.

name: complete Z-linked dominant inheritance
definition: A Z-linked dominant inheritance pattern wherein the trait associated with one allele completely masks the trait associated with a different allele found at that locus.

name: Y-linked inheritance
definition: An inheritance pattern wherein the trait is determined by alleles of a single causal gene on a Y-chromosome.

name: X-linked inheritance
definition: An inheritance pattern wherein the trait is determined by alleles of a single causal gene on an X-chromosome.

name: X-linked recessive inheritance
definition: An X-linked inheritance pattern wherein a trait caused by alleles of a gene on the X-chromosome manifests in homozygous but not heterozygote individuals.

name: X-linked dominant inheritance
definition: An X-linked inheritance pattern wherein the trait manifests in heterozygotes.

name: co-dominant X-linked inheritance
definition: An X-linked dominant inheritance pattern wherein a heterozygous individual simultaneously expresses the distinct traits associated with each allele in the heterozygous locus.

name: incomplete X-linked dominant inheritance
definition: An X-linked dominant inheritance pattern wherein the trait expressed in a heterozygous individual is intermediate between the trait expressed in individuals homozygous for either allele in the heterozygous locus.

name: complete X-linked dominant inheritance
definition: An X-linked dominant inheritance pattern wherein the trait associated with one allele completely masks the trait associated with a different allele found at that locus.

name: autosomal inheritance
definition: An inheritance pattern wherein the trait is determined by alleles of a single causal gene on a non-sex chromosome.

name: autosomal recessive inheritance
definition: An inheritance pattern wherein a trait caused by alleles of an autosomal gene manifests in homozygous but not heterozygote individuals.

name: sex-limited autosomal recessive inheritance
definition: An autosomal recessive inheritance pattern wherein the trait manifests only in homozygotes, and in a sex-specific manner (i.e. only in males or only in females).

name: autosomal dominant inheritance
definition: An inheritance pattern wherein a trait caused by alleles of an autosomal gene manifests in heterozygotes.

name: sex-limited autosomal dominant inheritance
definition: An autosomal dominant inheritance pattern wherein the trait manifests in heterozygotes in a sex-specific manner (i.e. only in males or only in females).

name: incomplete autosomal dominant inheritance
definition: An autosomal dominant inheritance pattern wherein the trait expressed in a heterozygous individual is intermediate between the trait expressed in individuals homozygous for either allele in the heterozygous locus.

name: complete autosomal dominant inheritance
definition: An autosomal dominant inheritance pattern wherein the trait associated with one allele completely masks the trait associated with a different allele found at that locus.

name: co-dominant autosomal inheritance
definition: An autosomal dominant inheritance pattern wherein a heterozygous individual simultaneously expresses the distinct traits associated with each allele in the heterozygous locus.

name: multifactorial inheritance
definition: An inheritance pattern that depends on a mixture of major and minor genetic determinants (i.e. alleles of more than one contributing genes), possibly together with environmental factors.; Diseases inherited in this manner are termed 'complex diseases'.

name: polygenic inheritance
definition: A multifactorial inheritance pattern that is determined by the simultaneous action of alleles a large number of genes.; Typically used for traits/conditions governed by more than three gene loci.

name: oligogenic inheritance
definition: A multifactorial inheritance pattern that is determined by the simultaneous action of alleles in few genes.; It is recommended this term be used for traits governed by three gene loci, although it is noted that usage of this term in the literature is not uniform.

name: digenic inheritance
definition: A multifactorial inheritance pattern that is determined by the simultaneous action of alleles in two genes.

name: undetermined inheritance
definition: An inheritance pattern that is not determined or not known.
